title: Help for Kids with Special Needs in School
summary: In England, some kids need extra help in school because they have special educational needs and disabilities, called SEND. Right now, they get a plan called an EHCP that says what help they should get. The government might change this plan. They want to check if kids still need the same help when they move from primary to secondary school. This could start in 2029. Some people, like teachers and politicians, say the current system is not working well and needs big changes. They want to make sure all kids get the right support. The new plan might give more kids legal rights to help through school-led plans. This is important because many kids have EHCPs, and parents often struggle to get them. The government says they will share more details soon.

background_read: In England, schools help kids who have special needs, like learning difficulties or disabilities. These kids might need extra things like therapy or one-on-one time with a teacher. A plan called an EHCP is made to list this help. Parents often work hard to get these plans, but the system can be tricky. The government is thinking about changing how this works to help more kids and make it fairer when they move to bigger schools.
Article_Structure: WHO: Kids with special educational needs and disabilities (SEND) in England, the government, teachers, and politicians.
WHAT: The government might review the support plans (EHCPs) for kids when they move from primary to secondary school, starting in 2029, and give more kids legal rights to help.
WHY: Because the current system is not working well, and people want to make sure all kids get the right support in school.

perspectives.description: The government wants to change the system to expand children's rights and create a more inclusive system, controlling costs by reassessing plans.
Teachers, like Paul Whiteman, say the current system fails children and schools, needing big changes.
Politicians, like the Liberal Democrats, argue the system needs a radical shake-up, not small fixes, because it is broken.
